subtitle: A filling snack for lunchboxes, picnics and buffets, or as a light lunch with mixed salad.

method.text: Season the flour. Roll the eggs in the flour to lightly coat.
In a bowl, mix together the sausage meat, cheese, tomato ketchup and parsley until well mixed.

Divide the sausage meat into portions. Flatten each piece out to form a round large enough to wrap around each egg. Shape them around the eggs to make a neat shape, making sure there are no cracks in the sausagemeat.
Place the beaten egg in a bowl. Dip the sausage-coated eggs into the beaten egg, shaking off any excess, then roll in the dried breadcrumbs until well coated.
Using a pastry brush, carefully brush the melted butter over the coated eggs and place on a baking tray.
Cook in the oven for 30 min, or until cooked and golden brown. Serve hot or cold.

title: Cheesy baked Scotch eggs
